title.narrative: Majuli Island Community Based Disaster Risk Reduction Project

description.narrative:
To combine and link a bottom-up approach to household and community preparedness and mitigation with a top-down approach to strengthening DRR capacity at block, sub-division and district levels towards ensuring a more resilient Majuli Island.
The core components of the proposed action include:
- Households and community level preparedness and mitigation (result one) with a focus on the most vulnerable and specific measures taken towards inclusion, which will encompass the essential processes towards strengthening resilience, including Hazard Vulnerability & Capacity Assessments and the design of GP Disaster Risk Reduction plans, households preparedness measures, Task Force Teams formation, community-based Early Warning Systems, strengthening of Village Disaster Management Councils/School Disaster Management Councils and strengthening of schools and evacuation sites. This component will take a bottom-up approach to Community Based Disaster Risk Reduction and will target 8 GPs.
- Strengthening of government DRR capacity (result two), with a focus on the block and sub-division level, but also incorporating district level bodies and line departments. Capacities to be strengthened will cover participatory/inclusive DRR planning and implementation; replication of DRR models and processes; technical skills on shelter, WASH and embankment strengthening; setting up and maintaining EWS; and design, review and implementation of disaster plans. This component will take a top-down approach to CBDRR.

Ward level Disaster Management Committees and GP level TFTs are formed and active in 8 GPs HVCAs are implemented in 5 GPs and facilitated in 3 GPs Household preparedness measures are consolidated and a preparedness campaign implemented in 5 GPs and replicated in 3 GPs 8 GP DRR plans are developed and mainstreamed into GP development plans Evacuation points are strengthened in 3 GPs and replicated in 1 GP
